title: (x) chunky serif on Kara Walker Exhibit book cover - ITC Grouch {Michael Albright}
content:
Can anyone identify this here face? It is currently being used for the Kara Walker Exhibit at the Walker in Minneapolis. The only picture I can find is this small gif of the book using it.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312081750im_/http:/typophile.com/files/k_walker_book_3-4_mockup_lrg_1_6210.GIF)
author: Colin Trechter

comments.content: Hard to see but it reminds me of Freight Big.

Found a better image of the cover. Definitely ain't Freight!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312081750im_/http:/typophile.com/files/093564086X_5499.01._SS500_SCLZZZZZZZ_.jpg)
thanks for that image! sorry mine was so hard to see.

Would that be the sadly unavailable ITC Grouch by Tom Carnase?

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/itc-grouch/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312081750/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/itc-grouch/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/itc-grouch/")

More information can be found here:

[http://typophile.com/node/16331](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312081750/http:/typophile.com/node/16331 "http://typophile.com/node/16331")
Yes, totally is, thank you, and of course it would have to be unavailable.
I have a Bitstream-version called 'GrouchITCbyBT-Regular', so it HAS been digitized…
Yes, but for some reason Bitstream discontinued it. I have a license as well.
